intro: Baeothryon pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered baeothryon, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and resemble those of other umbelliferous plants, though it is less commonly encountered in cultivation. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern in some regions.
